definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: It's your fault you didn't come to class on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 我考試沒考好是因爲我禮拜五沒有來上課？

sentences.english: We have asked the Conrads to come for dinner on Friday evening.
sentences.chinese: 我們已邀請康拉德一家在禮拜五晚上來喫飯。

sentences.english: The President's speech is scheduled on next Friday.
sentences.chinese: 總統的演說排定在下禮拜五。

sentences.english: What are you doing next Friday?
sentences.chinese: 下禮拜五您們籌算幹甚麼？

sentences.english: I have to take the next Friday off, because I have to pick up my mom at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 下禮拜五我得請假，因爲我得去機場接我媽媽。

sentences.english: I love a good loud honky tone that rocks on Friday nights.
sentences.chinese: 我愛禮拜五晚上搖滾裏一個震撼低級炮。

sentences.english: It was a Friday night and Dr. James Valek had clocked out for the day.
sentences.chinese: 又是一個禮拜五傍晚，已打卡下班的詹姆斯。

definition: time of day exactly on the hour (i.e. 12:00, 1:00 etc)/to make an inventory/(math.) point that has integer coordinates
see you tomorrow/(coll., jocular) food that passes through the digestive system more or less intact (esp. enoki mushrooms)
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
